name: Bratton, Douglas K.
title: Founder, CEO & Co-Chief Investment Officer
notes: Douglas K. Bratton founded Crestline Investors in 1997, growing it into a $19 billion credit alternative asset manager. Previously spent six years with Taylor & Company associated with members of the Bass family; holds BS from NC State (1981) and MBA with Honors from Duke University (1984).

name: Callan, John C. Jr.
title: Partner, Real Estate
notes: John C. (Clint) Callan Jr. advises clients on real estate transactions and land use matters for commercial, residential, retail, and industrial projects throughout California. A 1982 graduate of the University of San Francisco School of Law and 1978 UC Berkeley graduate; previously with McKenna Long & Aldridge and Luce Forward.
ngos: Represents educational institutions and nonprofits in real estate matters

name: Mullin, Peter W.
employer: M Financial Group (Retired) / Mullin Automotive Museum Foundation
title: Co-Founder & Chairman (Deceased, September 18, 2023)
notes: Peter W. Mullin (January 14, 1941 – September 18, 2023) founded Mullin Consulting in Los Angeles in 1969, which became the largest executive benefits company in the US, and co-founded M Financial Group in 1978. Served on the Board of Directors of Avery Dennison Corporation (1998-2013). Established the Mullin Automotive Museum in Oxnard, California in 2010.
ngos: Peter Mullin Automotive Museum Foundation; Trustee, ArtCenter College of Design

name: Noble, Morris Jr.
title: SVP and Regional Senior Investment Officer, Northern California and Pacific Northwest
notes: Morris H. Noble Jr. joined Northern Trust in 2008, bringing over 20 years of investment experience. Previously Executive Director at Morgan Stanley and SVP of US Trust's West Coast Family Wealth Management practice. Holds an MBA in Finance and BA in History from UC Berkeley.
ngos: Board member, Cypress Lawn Cemetery Association; Board member, Friends of Laguna Honda; California Rangeland Trust; The Guardsmen; Strategic Planning Committee, Saint Francis Memorial Hospital

name: O'Neill, Jeffrey Bryan
title: Founder & CEO
notes: Jeff O'Neill founded O'Neill Vintners & Distillers in 2004 after founding and leading Golden State Vintners (1985-2004), building it into California's fourth-largest winery before its sale. O'Neill Vintners is a certified B Corporation producing over seven million cases annually. Named Wine Enthusiast 2022 Person of the Year.
ngos: Executive Leadership Board, UC Davis Department of Viticulture and Enology; co-founded BIPOC scholarships at Cal Poly SLO and Sonoma State with Charles Woodson

name: Panitch, Sanford B.
title: President, Sony Pictures Motion Picture Group
notes: Sanford Panitch has been President of the Sony Pictures Motion Picture Group since October 2019, overseeing franchises including Spider-Man, Jumanji, Venom, and Bad Boys. Previously founded Fox International Productions (2008-2015) and served as President of Columbia Pictures (2016-2019). Attended Tulane University, majoring in Political Science.
ngos: Former Board Member, Student Voice Project

title: President & CEO

He and his brother Reid purchased the company from their father Brock in 2000. Started with the company as a union ironworker; oversees over 700 employees and international operations.

Prior to joining in 2018, he served as President of Coastland Capital, an asset manager in relative value and specialty finance strategies. Holds a BA in Economics and Psychology from Cornell University.

title: Former CEO & President
notes: William C. Trimble III co-founded Easterly Partners in 2011 and took Easterly Government Properties (NYSE: DEA) public in February 2015, serving as CEO until retiring December 31, 2023. Previously COO at PRP, LLC. Holds both MBA and BA from Duke University.

name: Berg, Jesse
title: Special Counsel
notes: Jesse Berg is a veteran corporate attorney with a 30-year career in technology, venture capital, and corporate law. Most recently served as General Counsel of Aumni, Inc. (acquired by J.P. Morgan in 2023). Earlier served as GC of OpenTV Corp. Holds a BA magna cum laude and JD from UC Berkeley (Boalt Hall), member of Phi Beta Kappa.

name: Burkett, William C.
employer: Evans Consoles Corporation / Specialty Finance Trust
title: Co-Founder & Chairman / Co-Founder
notes: William Burkett holds a BA in Economics with honors from Stanford (1978) and MBA from Yale (1983). Founded Burkett & Company, then became CEO of Evans Consoles in 2003. Co-founded Specialty Finance Trust in 2007, which purchases discounted Italian government healthcare receivables. Previously President of Security Properties and CM Equity Partners.

name: Cagley, James R.
title: Founding Principal (Retired)
notes: James R. Cagley founded the consulting structural engineering firm Cagley & Associates in 1973 (originally Martin & Cagley). He was President of the American Concrete Institute in 2005. Licensed in numerous states including California. Sold his interest in 2006 but remains on the board.
ngos: Board member, Applied Technology Council; National Institute of Building Sciences; American Council of Engineering Companies

name: Chisholm, Richard W.
title: CEO & Partner
notes: Richard George Chisholm is CEO and Partner of Evolution Capital Management LLC (since 2021) and CEO and Director of Evo Acquisition Corp. (since 2020). Previously Managing Director (Retired) at Wells Fargo Securities. Holds a BA in Political Science from the University of Michigan and a JD, cum laude, from UC Hastings Law (now UC Law San Francisco).

name: Congdon, Jeffrey H.
title: Managing Partner
notes: Jeffrey H. Congdon has spent a 45-year career in the institutional real estate market in San Francisco, specializing in investment sales, debt/equity financing, and joint venture partnerships. Previously with Transwestern, Kidder Mathews, Helmsley Spear West/Swig Equities, and Cushman. Holds a degree from USC.

name: Dickinson, Jon M.D.
title: Orthopaedic Surgeon & Associate Clinical Professor
notes: Dr. Jon A. Dickinson is an orthopaedic surgeon in San Francisco specializing in sports medicine. Team physician for the Oakland A's baseball team and orthopaedic consultant for the San Francisco Ballet. Associate Clinical Professor of Orthopaedic Surgery at UCSF. BS from UC San Diego (1979), MD from Tulane University, residency at UCSF (completed 1990).

name: Farley, William F.
employer: Fruit of the Loom (Former) / Various ventures
title: Former Chairman & CEO
notes: William F. Farley (born 1942) was Chairman and CEO of Fruit of the Loom for 15 years (1985-1999), growing the company from $500M to $2.5B in sales before its 1999 bankruptcy filing. Known for aggressive leveraged buyouts in consumer goods. Received the Horatio Alger Award in 1986. Graduate of Bowdoin College (1964) and Boston College Law School.
ngos: Board, Horatio Alger Association of Distinguished Americans; Board, Big Shoulders Fund; Board, Rush Hospital Heart Institute
political_donations: Historically bipartisan donations; $1,000 to Paul Simon (D) in 1984; $63,000 to Democratic causes in 1988; later donated to Bush-Cheney '04 and $10,000+ to Trump Victory fund in 2016

name: Jaquier, Guy F.
title: Former CEO, Private Capital
notes: Guy F. Jaquier has over 35 years of real estate finance and investment experience. Served as CEO of Private Capital at Prologis until his 2013 retirement. Previously joined AMB Property Corporation in 2000 as CIO, starting its international business and serving as President of Europe and Asia. Prior to AMB, was Senior Investment Officer for Real Estate at CalPERS. Holds an MBA from Harvard and BS in Building Construction Management from University of Washington.
ngos: Board, Hightower (joined 2016); Board, Equilibrium Capital (joined 2014); Advisory Board, Swig Company; Advisory Board, Juniper Square; Runstad Center for Real Estate Studies, University of Washington

name: Longyear, Douglas M.
title: Executive Director, Net Lease Group
notes: Douglas M. Longyear is a member of the Net Lease Group at Cushman & Wakefield and one of the top agents in the US for selling single-tenant, net-leased industrial properties. Has sold more FedEx distribution buildings than any other agent in the US since 2010, completing over $1 billion in transactions. Holds MBA and BA degrees from UCLA.

name: MacCorkle, Jeffrey W.
title: Managing Director
notes: Jeffrey MacCorkle is Managing Director of Pacific Rim Resources, a coal, power, and infrastructure developer in China and Indonesia. Spent 20 years as a senior management consultant in China's energy sector and was a partner with Booz & Company leading their Beijing office. Son of Emmett 'Mac' MacCorkle III, founder of MacCorkle Insurance Services (Burlingame, CA). Holds BA from Cornell, MBA from USC International Business Program.
ngos: Former board member and Secretary, American Chamber of Commerce in PRC (Beijing)

name: Maloney, Graham
employer: Greene Radovsky Maloney Share & Hennigh LLP
title: Founding Partner
notes: Graham Maloney is a founding partner of the San Francisco law firm Greene Radovsky Maloney Share & Hennigh LLP (established 1984), specializing in complex real property matters including acquisitions, leasing, financing, and development. Also practices banking and environmental law. Holds a JD (1973) from UC Hastings and a BA magna cum laude (1970) from Harvard College.

name: Meyersieck, Kenneth W.
title: Managing Director – East Bay
notes: Kenneth W. Meyersieck has over 35 years of commercial real estate experience in the San Francisco Bay Area. Began career at ComCore Colliers International (1986), opened the Colliers Oakland office in 1996, and joined Transwestern in 2020 to head East Bay operations. Represented over 4 million square feet in transactions totaling over $1.6 billion. Holds a BS from UC Berkeley and MBA from Golden Gate University.

name: Miller, Bruce L.
title: CEO
notes: Bruce Miller co-founded Investure in 2004 and became CEO in January 2018, overseeing private asset class investments including venture capital, buyouts, and real estate. Previously a Partner at Carmel Partners (Northern California real estate PE), VP Corporate Development at iMediation, and at Intel Capital. Holds a BA in Economics from the University of Virginia and an MBA from UNC Chapel Hill (Trammell Crow Fellow).

name: Placzek, C. Alex
title: Director of Marketing - Shopper COE
notes: C. Alex Placzek is based in Lafayette, California and works as a marketing director at Nestle. Background includes roles at Dreyer's Grand Ice Cream and Nestle Purina North America. Holds a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration from Colorado State University (1993-1997).

name: Reeder, Milton K.
title: Founder & CEO
notes: Milton K. Reeder founded Accent Capital Partners in 2002, a San Francisco-based CEO advisory and financing firm. Previously COO at Meridian Industrial Trust (NYSE: MDN), overseeing its $1.5B sale to ProLogis. Has expertise as CEO, COO, and CFO with a track record in private equity and debt capital markets. Holds a BBA from University of Michigan Ross School of Business (1975-1979).
ngos: Advisory Board Chairman, UCR Group LLC (Redlands, CA real estate development)

name: Rosati, Mario M.
title: Partner (Retired January 2020)
notes: Mario M. Rosati joined Wilson Sonsini in 1971, became partner in 1975, and retired in January 2020. He specialized in corporate law for technology companies and managed the WS Investments partnership. From 1994 to 2012 he was an adjunct professor at UC Berkeley Haas School of Business and Boalt Hall, teaching new venture finance. His name is part of the firm's name after becoming a name partner.

name: Ryan, T. J. III
employer: Ryan Motorsports Group / ISU Steadfast Insurance Agency Network
title: Chief Executive
notes: T.J. Ryan III has headed ISU Insurance Agency Network since 1985, growing it into the second-largest agency network in the US with over $2 billion in written premium and 150+ offices in 28 states. Previously at Sedgwick Group plc (London) and Mason McDuffie Agency (Walnut Creek, CA). Holds a BA in English Literature from Connecticut College (1976-1980).

title: Attorney

The firm operates in Nevada and California. Public records indicate he is approximately 67 years old and resides in Nevada.

name: Scheuer, Edward J.
title: Founder
notes: Ed Scheuer founded Capius Consulting after a career spanning over 20 years. He was a partner in the Life Sciences practice of Strategic Decisions Group and a member of that firm's Board of Directors. Previously Regional Managing Director of Protiviti's Pacific Northwest practice and head of its Life Sciences industry group. Began career with Price Waterhouse (UK) and Arthur Andersen (US). Holds an MBA from Stanford GSB and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of England and Wales.

name: Schnitzer, Bruce W.
title: Founder, Chairman & Managing Director
notes: Bruce W. Schnitzer founded Wand Partners in 1987, specializing in middle-market buyouts focused on specialty financial services and insurance. Previously President & CEO of Marsh & McLennan, Inc. (1983-1985), the world's largest insurance brokerage. Earlier was VP and head of M&A at JP Morgan/Morgan Guaranty Trust (1967-1976). Graduated from University of Texas at Austin with a BA (1966) and MBA (1967).
ngos: Chairman, Institute of Human Origins; Director, Litchfield Land Trust; Director & President, Scherr-Thoss Foundation (Litchfield, CT); Board member, Beneficient (BENF) since 2023

name: Smit, Steve P.
title: VP General Manager, Central Coast (Former)
notes: Steve P. Smit has been in the California wine business for over 30 years. Started at Foundation Plant Services in Davis, CA as a viticulturist, then spent 15 years at Clos Du Bois winery in Sonoma County. At Constellation Brands managed the annual grape supply of 35 million cases across 13,000+ acres in California and Washington. Past president of the California Sustainable Winegrowers Alliance. Holds a BS in Chemistry from UC Berkeley and MS in Viticulture from UC Davis.
ngos: Past President, California Sustainable Winegrowers Alliance; Former President, Sonoma County Viticulture Technical Group

name: Stock, John Van Maren
title: Former President
notes: John Van Maren Stock (born August 3, 1918, San Francisco, CA) served as President of Saylor & Hill Co., an insurance brokerage in Oakland, from 1977 until his retirement in 2005. Following World War II, he began his career as a salesman with Atlantic Richfield Company before joining Saylor & Hill in 1954. His mother was May Van Maren Stock.

name: Wang, Da-Gang
employer: Wang Wellness / American College of Traditional Chinese Medicine (former)
title: Founder / Clinic Supervisor (former)
notes: Dr. Da-Gang Wang, DAOM, Dipl.O.M., NCCAOM, L.Ac., is an acupuncturist in San Francisco who specializes in Lyme Disease and Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS). Previously served as Clinic Supervisor at the American College of Traditional Chinese Medicine (ACTCM) in San Francisco. Holds a DAOM from Five Branches University and MS from ACTCM.

name: Ware, Lincoln
title: Radio Talk Show Host
notes: Lincoln Ware is a 51-year Cincinnati radio veteran and the longest-running local African-American radio personality in Cincinnati. Hosts midday talk show on WDBZ-AM (1230) 'The Buzz' since 2000. Started in Cincinnati radio in 1973 at WCIN-AM. A U.S. Marine veteran. Also hosts the TV show 'Cincinnati Issues with Lincoln Ware.' Nominated for national Radio Hall of Fame (2024). Honored with 'Lincoln Ware Way' street name in Cincinnati (2023). Note: the prompt referenced WDTD/WOKB in Tampa, but extensive research confirms Ware is Cincinnati-based.
